oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Church of God in Jesus Christ Name service, 2002 April 5
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Hood, Ralph W.; Williamson, W. Paul (William Paul)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Video recording of a service opening with the testimony of Bobby Smart. Sister Lynn testifies, and Brother Bob and Jimmy Morrow lead the congregation in prayer. Following this Jason Barnes, and Sister Lynn play guitar and lead the congregation in song. As the music fades, Jimmy Morrow begins a sermon during which he handles a serpent. The congregation joins in the serpent handling and after another hymn. Jason Barnes begins speaking in tongues and laying hands on the congregation. Other members of the congregation testify. Bobby Smart closes the service with a prayer.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Appalachian Region, Southern--Religious life and customs; Extemporaneous preaching; Glossolalia; Imposition of hands; Lay preaching; Pentecostal preaching; Prayer; Snake cults (Holiness churches)--Appalachian Region, Southern; Singing--Religious aspects;Witness bearing (Christianity)
Barnes, Jason; Morrow, Jimmy; Morrow, Pam; Smart, Bobby
Edwina Church of God in Jesus Christ's Name (Del Rio, Tenn.)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:source: Church of God in Jesus Christ Name field recordings, 2002-2004
Ralph W. Hood and W. Paul Williamson field recordings, interviews, and photographs
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:isPartOf: Ralph W. Hood and W. Paul Williamson Holiness Churches of Appalachia recordings and interviews
